Bekka_&_Billy:
{{Short description|US musical group}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2022}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Bekka & Billy | image = | caption = | image_size = | alias = | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1997–1998 | label = [[Almo Sounds]] |spinoff_of = [[Fleetwood Mac]] | past_members = [[Bekka Bramlett]]
[[Billy Burnette]] }} '''Bekka & Billy''' was an American country music duo consisting of singer-songwriters [[Bekka Bramlett]] and [[Billy Burnette]], who first worked together as members of [[Fleetwood Mac]].{{Cite web |url=http://bla.fleetwoodmac.net/index.php?page=index_v2&id=81&c=13 |title=Archived copy |access-date=2009-02-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070923222725/http://bla.fleetwoodmac.net/index.php?page=index_v2&id=81&c=13 |archive-date=2007-09-23 |url-status=dead }} Their eponymous debut album was released by [[Almo Sounds]] in April 1997. While their debut single, "Patient Heart," failed to chart in the United States, it reached No. 96 on the ''[[RPM (magazine)|RPM]]'' Country Tracks chart in Canada.{{Cite web |url=http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/rpm/028020-119.01-e.php?brws_s=1&file_num=nlc008388.8289&volume=65&issue=11&issue_dt=May%2019%201997&type=1&interval=24&PHPSESSID=85u3t0aesdurkjmb4ecvegl3n5 |title=RPM Volume 65 No. 11, May 19 1997 - RPM |access-date=2009-02-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121007022555/http://www.collectionscanada.gc.ca/rpm/028020-119.01-e.php?brws_s=1&file_num=nlc008388.8289&volume=65&issue=11&issue_dt=May%2019%201997&type=1&interval=24&PHPSESSID=85u3t0aesdurkjmb4ecvegl3n5 |archive-date=2012-10-07 |url-status=dead }} ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' gave ''Bekka & Billy'' a B rating, saying that if "Patient Heart" didn't become a big hit, Nashville was "asleep at the wheel."{{Cite web|url=https://ew.com/article/1997/06/06/bekka-billy/|title=Bekka & Billy|website=Ew.com|access-date=2020-04-08}} [[AllMusic]] gave their album three stars, calling the duo "tailor made for stardom."[{{AllMusic|class=album|id=r259933|pure_url=yes}} ((( Bekka & Billy > Overview )))], [[AllMusic]] [[Vince Gill]] played guitar on the album, which featured a song written by [[Delaney Bramlett]].{{Cite web |url=http://bla.fleetwoodmac.net/index.php?page=index_v2&id=80&c=13 |title=Archived copy |access-date=2009-02-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070923222820/http://bla.fleetwoodmac.net/index.php?page=index_v2&id=80&c=13 |archive-date=2007-09-23 |url-status=dead }} The duo went their separate ways in January 1998.{{Cite web |url=http://bla.fleetwoodmac.net/index.php?page=index_v2&id=82&c=13 |title=Archived copy |access-date=2009-02-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071206091656/http://bla.fleetwoodmac.net/index.php?page=index_v2&id=82&c=13 |archive-date=2007-12-06 |url-status=dead }} ==Discography== ===Studio albums===
